intro: Cylista scariosa, commonly known as the scarious cylista, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features slender, branched stems and pinnately divided leaves with a distinctive, slightly hairy surface. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in complex umbels, typical of the carrot family. Cylista scariosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
